attributes.action: Force the Royal Mail to remove North Humberside from its postcode finder software and reinstate East Riding of Yorkshire
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: North Humberside was abolished in April 1996 and the county returned to its historical name of East Riding of Yorkshire.   Residents and businesses are still received mail addressed to North Humberside, a name which is disliked.   The culprit appears to be the Royal Mail and its postcode finder software which still has North Humberside in the data, ten years after abolition.
